article.title: Predicting the Popularity of Online Videos via Deep Neural Networks

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary advantage of using hard parameter sharing in multi-task learning?
choices: It allows each task to learn completely independent representations.
It reduces the risk of overfitting by sharing information between tasks.
It significantly increases the number of parameters in the model.
It eliminates the need for task-specific output layers.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of Figure 1, what do the "Task-specific Layers" represent?
choices: Shared representations learned from all input tasks.
Layers responsible for processing the input data.
Individual output layers tailored for each specific task.
Layers responsible for combining the outputs of all tasks.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the role of the function \'g\' in the relation network?
choices: It combines the relations between the main object and all related objects.
It captures the pairwise relationship between the main object and each related object.
It generates the final prediction based on the combined relations.
It transforms the input objects into high-level representations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary purpose of the relation network depicted in Figure 2?
choices: To independently process each object without considering their relationships.
To predict the properties of the main object based on its relations with other objects.
To learn a general representation of all objects without distinguishing the main object.
To cluster the objects into different groups based on their similarities.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which three modules constitute the proposed prediction model for online video popularity?
choices: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), Recurrent Neural Network (RNN), Generative Adversarial Network (GAN).
Deep Neural Network (DNN), Relation Network (RN), Multi-Task Learning (MTL) Module.
Support Vector Machine (SVM), K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Random Forest (RF).
Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), Autoencoder, Boltzmann Machine.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the model in Figure 3 incorporate information about competing videos?
choices: It uses a separate DNN branch to process features from competing videos.
It feeds the features of competing videos directly into the MTL module.
It utilizes the Relation Network (RN) to model the relationships between the target video and related videos.
It doesn\'t explicitly consider competing videos in its prediction process.
